components.description:
A cartoon-styled representation of a collision. Depicted as a star-like, orange-and-yellow fiery burst, generally with one point extending to the bottom right, as if from the source of the collision.

title: Collision Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Comic style symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A symbol that represents a crash or collision.Â An angular burst of orange and red in a star-like shape. Collision was approved as part of Un http://emojipedia.org/collision-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: collision

bn:00102595a: Serving to explode or characterized by explosion or sudden outburst
With the capability to, or likely to, explode.

bn:00083678v: Cause to burst with a violent release of energy

bn:00083756v: Throw bombs at or attack with bombs
To attack something with bombs, artillery shells or other missiles or projectiles.
To attack by using one or more bombs.
To attack using one or more bombs; to bombard.

bn:00083680v: To expand suddenly with great force, a loud noise and release energy because of strong inner pressure due to a violent chemical or physical reaction.
Burst and release energy as through a violent chemical or physical reaction;"the bomb detonated at noon"

bn:00008341n: A firework consisting of a string of bangers linked by a fuse designed to emit a series of loud bangs when lit.
A small explosive device primarily designed to produce a loud noise
Small explosive device primarily designed to make noise

A firework consisting of a string of bangers linked by a fuse designed to emit a series of loud bangs when lit. Traditionally used in Chinese celebrations (e.g. Chinese New Year) to scare off ghosts and bad spirits and to bring good luck.
Firework consisting of a small explosive charge and fuse in a heavy paper casing
A firecracker is a small explosive device primarily designed to produce a large amount of noise, especially in the form of a loud bang; any visual effect is incidental to this goal.

bn:00020670n: (physics) a brief event in which two or more bodies come together
A collision is an isolated event in which two or more moving bodies exert forces on each other for a relatively short time.
An impact between two or more moving objects
An often violent body impact with another.
Contact between objects in which physical force is exerted on each

bn:00011468n: An explosion is a rapid increase in volume and release of energy in an extreme manner, usually with the generation of high temperatures and the release of gases.
A violent release of energy caused by a chemical or nuclear reaction

A violent, sudden release of energy resulting from powders or gases undergoing instantaneous ignition or from some other means of detonation, often accompanied by a force producing great amounts of heat, major structural damages, shock waves and flying shrapnel.
A rapid increase in volume and release of energy in an extreme manner
Sudden release of energy through high temperatures and gas expansion
A violent release of energy (sometimes mechanical, nuclear, or chemical.)

bn:00009919n: A steady bright blue light; formerly used as a signal but now a firework
A bright blue flare, formerly used in signalling, but now chiefly as fireworks.
Fireworks are a class of explosive pyrotechnic devices used for aesthetic, cultural, and religious purposes.
Such as firecrackers, bottle rockets, bang snaps and others
An event or a display where fireworks are set off.

bn:00011917n: Bombs are any of a range of explosive weapons that only rely on the exothermic reaction of an explosive material to provide an extremely sudden and violent release of energy.
An explosive device fused to explode under specific conditions
A bomb is any of a range of explosive weapons that only rely on the exothermic reaction of an explosive material to provide an extremely sudden and violent release of energy.
An explosive device used or intended as a weapon.
A device filled with explosives used for destroying things.

bn:00008250n: Representing a loud noise or heavy impact.
Any loud, sudden, explosive sound made by striking hard surfaces together, or resembling such a sound.
